meanings.definition: A body of troops or police officers standing or moving in close formation.
meanings.sent1: The phalanxes of soldiers marched in perfect unison.
meanings.sent2: The police officers formed phalanxes to control the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The phalanxes of ducks waddled in a straight line, looking quite organized.
meanings.sent4: The phalanxes of trees stood tall and strong, like an army guarding the forest.
meanings.sent5: The phalanxes of ants worked together to carry a large piece of food back to their nest.

meanings.definition: A set of people or things closely united for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The phalanxes of volunteers worked tirelessly to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: The phalanxes of students gathered to protest against unfair policies.
meanings.sent3: The phalanxes of books on the shelf seemed to be whispering to each other.
meanings.sent4: The phalanxes of clouds in the sky moved as one, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The phalanxes of candles lit up the room, providing a warm and cozy atmosphere.
